main event: On 20 August 1956, in North Bend, Oregon, a UFO was tracked on ground radar, then visually observed. The object was initially sighted at 54,000 ft altitude, appeared to orbit, then descended to 50,000 ft altitude before fading from view, being tracked for two hours.
interesting points: The object was tracked on ground radar before being visually observed, adding credibility to the sighting.
It was initially sighted at a high altitude of 54,000 ft and appeared to orbit before descending to 50,000 ft.
The object was tracked for a significant duration of two hours before fading from view.
The conclusion was inconclusive, listing possibilities such as balloon, aircraft, and astronomical phenomena.
The sighting involved military sources, adding to the credibility of the observation.
sighted object: Unidentified object tracked on ground radar and visually observed
